author: Mansi Agarwal
content: IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal has invested $20 million (around ₹165 crore) in B2B manufacturing services startup Zetwerk through Wheelhouse Venture Capital. In 2021, the startup raised $150 million from Lightspeed, Sequoia and others at a $1.3 billion valuation to become a unicorn. Zetwerk currently has a valuation of $2.8 billion, Moneycontrol reported.
title: IndiGo Co-founder Gangwal invests ₹165 cr in B2B unicorn Zetwerk

author: Prashant Singh
content: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has issued frequent asked questions (FAQs) regarding concerns by customers on credit card and debit card guidelines. It comes in response to the circular issued by RBI on March 06 titled ‘amendment to the master director – Credit card and Debit card’. RBI has tried to answer some important questions that might affect customers directly.
title: RBI releases FAQs on credit card guidelines

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal reportedly plans to sell a 3.3% stake in InterGlobe Aviation, the airline's parent company, for over ₹3,700 crore on Monday. The floor price for the sale has been fixed at ₹2,925 per share, reports said. Gangwal and his family trust collectively owned around 25% stake in InterGlobe Aviation as of December 2023.
title: IndiGo Co-founder Gangwal to sell 3% stake for ₹3,700 cr: Reports

author: Vivek
content: Flipkart is planning to launch a quick commerce service offering 10-15 minute delivery in a dozen cities within the next six to eight weeks, multiple media outlets reported. The move directly challenges existing quick commerce players like Zepto and Zomato's Blinkit. Notably, It is setting up a network of dark stores in key cities, including Bengaluru, Delhi (NCR), and Hyderabad.
title: Flipkart to start 15-min delivery to challenge Zepto, Blinkit

author: Vardan P
content: Indian equity market closed on a flat note in the volatile session on Thursday after hitting record highs. At the closing bell, the Sensex was up 33.40 points at 74,119.39, and the Nifty was up 19.50 points at 22,493.50. Top Nifty losers of the day were M&M, BPCL, Reliance Industries, Axis Bank and ICICI Bank.
title: Ten stocks close to their 52-week low

author: Mohul
content: The Union Cabinet greenlights a 4% increase in dearness allowance for central government employees, totaling it to 50%. This decision, influenced by the Consumer Price Index (CPI) data, will benefit 50 lakh employees and 68 lakh pensioners. The hike, costing the government Rs 12,868 crore, aligns with the 7th Pay Commission's formula, providing relief from inflationary pressures.
title: Big news for 50 lakh Govt employees: DA become 50%

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: Apple has terminated a developer account of Fortnite maker Epic Games that was going to launch the Epic Games Store on iOS devices in the European Union. Apple cited past violations by Epic for terminating its Sweden AB developer account. "Competition is a fragile thing. Apple can crush it...by selectively blocking specific competitors like us," Epic's CEO Tim Sweeney said.
title: Apple terminates Fortnite maker Epic's Sweden developer account

author: Vivek
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, overseeing Communication, Railways, and Electronics & IT, has launched the 'NITI For States' platform with the aim of bolstering digital governance and informed decision-making. The initiative by NITI Aayog aims to establish a robust Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) for policy and good governance.
title: Vaishnaw launches NITI Aayog's digital public infra platform

author: Vivek
content: IBM has signed an MoU with the Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) to enhance High Performance Computing (HPC) in India. The partnership aims to foster the growth of India's developer community by focusing on processor design, system design, firmware, and application development, including contributions to open-source initiatives.
title: IBM, C-DAC to enhance High Performance Computing (HPC) in India

author: Mansi Agarwal
content: SEBI on Thursday issued an interim order, barring JM Financial from taking any new mandate for acting as a lead manager for any public issue of debt securities. This comes after the regulator noticed irregularities in the public issues of non-convertible debentures in 2023. Earlier this week, RBI barred JM from doing any form of financing against shares and debentures.
title: SEBI bars JM Financial from being lead manager of public debt issues
